oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Caney Fork River flooded near McMinnville
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In 1928, the Caney Fork River and its tributaries flooded the McMinnville, Tennessee area. This image shows how the flood impacted the river.

Prior to the development of the Tennessee Valley Authority (TVA), many rivers in the Tennessee river valley flooded. The development of TVA's system of dams and reservoirs helped control the river's navigation and provided flood control.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Crouch, Arthur W., Tennessee Electric Power Company Collection, 1860 - 1939
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Flood Damage
Photographs
